isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - REASSEMBLE - AUXILIARY SECTION

step1.para: Mark the timing teeth on the LO Range gear ( Figure 143). A highly visible color of toolmaker's dye is recommended.

figure.caption: Figure 143. Mark Timing Teeth on LO Range Gear

step1.para: Mark one gear tooth on the LO Range gear, front side.
Then mark the tooth which is directly opposite the first one marked. There should be the same number of teeth between the markings on each side of the gear.
If previously removed, install the bushings in the coupler ( Figure 144).

figure.caption: Figure 144. Install Bushings in Coupler

step1.para: Install the splined washer in the LO Range gear hub ( Figure 145).

figure.caption: Figure 145. Install Splined Washer in LO Range Gear Hub

step1.para: Install the LO Range gear over the coupler, matching the coupler external splines with the LO Range gear internal splines ( Figure 146).

figure.caption: Figure 146. Install LO Range Gear Over Coupler

step1.para: Rotate the splined washer in the coupler groove to engage the external splines with the LO Range gear clutching teeth ( Figure 147).

figure.caption: Figure 147. Rotate Splined Washer in Coupler Groove

step1.para: Align the washer splines and install the pins in the coupler with a punch and hammer to lock LO Range gear to the coupler ( Figure 148).

figure.caption: Figure 148. Install Pins in Coupler

svcsubproc.title: Output Shaft and Rear Bearing Assemblies

step1.para: Mark the timing teeth on the reduction gear ( Figure 149). A highly visible color of toolmaker's dye is recommended.
Mark one gear tooth on the reduction gear, front side.
Then mark the tooth which is directly opposite the first one marked. There should be the same number of teeth between the markings on each side of the gear.

figure.caption: Figure 149. Mark Timing Teeth on Reduction Gear

step1.para: Place the output shaft in a vise ( Figure 150). Slide the splined washer on the output shaft; the stepped side up.

figure.caption: Figure 150. Place Output Shaft in Vise

step1.para: Install the reduction gear on the output shaft with the clutching teeth facing down ( Figure 151).

figure.caption: Figure 151. Install Reduction Gear on Output Shaft

step1.para: Put oil on all thrust surfaces. Install the reduction gear washer ( Figure 152).

figure.caption: Figure 152. Install Reduction Gear Washer

step1.para: Heat the front bearing cone and install on the output shaft against the reduction gear washer, bearing taper up ( Figure 153). The bearing can also be installed using a suitable driver.

figure.caption: Figure 153. Install Front Bearing Cone on Output Shaft

note.para: Do not heat bearing above 275°F (136°C). If possible, use heat lamps as source.

step1.para: Remove the assembly from the vise and turn it upside down on a table ( Figure 154). Install the reduction yoke sliding clutch.

figure.caption: Figure 154. Remove Assembly From Vise

step1.para: Install the LO Range gear and coupler assembly on the output shaft with the reduction gear clutching teeth upward ( Figure 155).

figure.caption: Figure 155. Install LO Range Gear and Coupler Assembly on Output Shaft

step1.para: Insert the dowel pin through the output shaft ( Figure 156).

figure.caption: Figure 156. Insert Dowel Pin Through Output Shaft

step1.para: Place the retainer washer on the output shaft ( Figure 157).

figure.caption: Figure 157. Place Retainer Washer on Output Shaft

step1.para: Install the coupler retaining nut on the output shaft ( Figure 158). Tighten to 180 to 210 ft-lbs. (244 to 285 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 158. Install Coupler Retaining Nut on Output Shaft

step1.para: Place the larger low range synchronizer ring on a bench and install the sliding clutch on the low range synchronizer pins, recessed side up ( Figure 159).

figure.caption: Figure 159. Install Sliding Clutch on Low Range Synchronizer Pins

step1.para: Install the three springs in the bores of the high range synchronizer ring ( Figure 160).

figure.caption: Figure 160. Install Springs in High Range Synchronizer Ring Bores

step1.para: Place the high range synchronizer ring over the ring pins of the low range synchronizer ( Figure 161).

figure.caption: Figure 161. Place High Range Synchronizer Ring Over Low Range Synchronizer Ring Pins

step1.para: Apply downward pressure to the high range synchronizer ring WHILE TWISTING COUNTERCLOCKWISE to compress the springs and fully seat the ring on the blocker pins of the low range synchronizer ( Figure 162).

figure.caption: Figure 162. Seat High Range Synchronizer Ring on Low Range Synchronizer Blocker Pins

step1.para: Install the synchronizer on the output shaft with the low range synchronizer ring down ( Figure 163).

figure.caption: Figure 163. Install Synchronizer on Output Shaft

step1.para: If previously removed, install the tapered bearing on the front of the auxiliary countershaft ( Figure 164). Use a suitable bearing driver to seat the bearings.

figure.caption: Figure 164. Install Tapered Bearing on Front of Auxiliary Countershaft

step1.para: On the low range gear of each auxiliary countershaft assembly, locate the two "O's" stamped on the two teeth. Mark both teeth with a highly visible toolmaker's dye ( Figure 165). Repeat the procedure on each auxiliary countershaft reduction gear.

figure.caption: Figure 165. Locate "O's" Stamped on Teeth
